Content: 2*p42929a0224*section aanswer all questions.for questions 110, in section a, select one answer from a to d and put a cross in the box .   if you change your mind, put a line through the box  and then  mark your new answer with a cross .1 a sample of gas is made of a mixture of nitrogen and oxygen.  at a given temperature the average molecular kinetic energy is  a the same for molecules of both gases.  b greater for nitrogen molecules.  c greater for oxygen molecules.  d dependent upon the amount of each gas.(total for question 1 = 1 mark)2 a person stands on the surface of the earth. the gravitational force between the person and the earth does not depend on   a the mass of the person.  b the mass of the earth.  c the rate of rotation of the earth.  d the position of the person.(total for question 2 = 1 mark)3 trigonometric parallax can only be used to determine distances to  a nearby stars.  b distant stars.  c nearby galaxies.  d distant galaxies.(total for question 3 = 1 mark)

3*p42929a0324*turn over    4 a system is made to oscillate by a driver force. which of the following conditions must be met for resonance of the system to occur?  a the driver force must be large.  b the frequency of the driver must equal the natural frequency of the system.  c the initial amplitude of the system must be small.  d the system must have no damping.(total for question 4 = 1 mark)5 internal energy of a system is the   a sum of the molecular kinetic and potential energies.  b molecular kinetic energy alone.  c molecular potential energy alone.  d difference between the molecular kinetic and potential energies.(total for question 5 = 1 mark)

4*p42929a0424*6 the graph shows how the acceleration varies with time for an object undergoing simple harmonic motion. which of the following graphs, a, b, c or d, shows how the displacement of the object varies with time?  a  b  c  d(total for question 6 = 1 mark)at0axt0bxt0cxt0dxt0

5*p42929a0524*turn over    7 dark energy appears to be increasing the rate at which the universe expands.   as a result it is more likely that the universe is  a closed.  b open.  c infinite in size.  d younger than we thought.(total for question 7 = 1 mark)8 for a system to undergo simple harmonic motion which of these energies must remain constant?total energy       kinetic energy       potential energy  a all of these energies  b kinetic energy only  c potential energy only  d none of these energies(total for question 8 = 1 mark)

(a) the swimming pool contains 1.6  104 kg of water at a temperature of 12 c.  calculate how much energy an electric heater must supply to raise the temperature of the water to 20 c.  state any assumption that you have made.  specific heat capacity of water = 4200 j kg k(3)    energy = assumption     (b) the electric heater runs from a 230 v supply and takes 30 hours to supply 0.55 gj of thermal energy.  calculate the current in the heater.(3)    current = (total for question 13 = 6 marks)

12*p42929a01224*15 the rings of saturn consist of countless small pieces of ice and rock orbiting the planet.  the particles range in size from a few centimetres to a few metres.xy (a) when the rings are observed from the earth, sunlight reflected from x is found to have slightly longer wavelengths than sunlight reflected from y.  suggest a reason for these observations.(2)

14*p42929a01424*16 in one type of fission reactor the coolant is a liquid metal alloy of sodium and potassium.  the sodium absorbs neutrons from the reactor core and becomes the isotope sodium-24.   sodium-24 emits both beta and gamma radiation. *(a) state what is meant by nuclear fission and explain why energy is released during the fission of a nucleus such as uranium.(3)         heat exchangercontrol rodsliquid metalshieldingcore

(2)    (total for question 16 = 9 marks)
